subject: asserting from a sub-thread
msgSnippet: Using JUnit, is it possible to write a test case that creates multiple threads and then uses assert* methods in those threads?  I know this sounds like a
messageBody:
Using JUnit, is it possible to write a test case that creates multiple
threads and then uses assert* methods in those threads? I know this
sounds like a complicated test, but a coworker was wondering how to do
this and none of us could think of a good way.

When the assert* fails, an exception is thrown in the sub-thread, but it
never propagates up to the main (original) thread, of course. So, the
test runner has no idea that assert* failed, and the test case carries
on its merry way.

Any thoughts on how people generally resolve this sort of problem? Is
the answer to make a simpler test case that doesn't rely on using an
asser* in a separate thread?


Todd.
